pull.title: guix: update time-machine to 5cb84f2013c5b1e48a7d0e617032266f1e6059e2
pull.body:
https://codeberg.org/guix/guix/commit/5cb84f2013c5b1e48a7d0e617032266f1e6059e2 isn't super recent, but it's enough to get access to some newer packages, such as LLVM 19, and avoids having to add any further work arounds for things that we know are fixed later (i.e nsis). Once things upstream have stabilized a bit more (the `core-updates` branch was fairly recently merged), we could look at bumping to something newer.

Package updates:
(base) glibc 2.35 -> 2.39
binutils 2.38 -> 2.41
diffutils 3.8 -> 3.10
gawk 5.2.1 -> 5.3.0
git-minimal 2.45.2 -> 2.46.0
grep 3.8 -> 3.11
gzip 1.12 -> 1.13
linux-headers 6.1.106 -> 6.1.119
make 4.3 -> 4.4.1
xz 5.2.8 -> 5.4.5

CMake 3.30 becomes available.
Clang/LLVM 19 becomes available.

Could be used for #32764.

<!--174a7506f384e20aa4161008e828411d-->
### Conflicts
Reviewers, this pull request conflicts with the following ones:

* [#32764](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/32764) (guix: Build for macOS using Clang only by hebasto)
* [#32655](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/32655) (depends: sqlite 3.50.4; switch to autosetup by fanquake)
* [#25573](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/25573) ([POC] guix: produce a fully `-static-pie` bitcoind by fanquake)
* [#24123](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/24123) (guix: Pointer Authentication and Branch Target Identification for aarch64 Linux by fanquake)

If you consider this pull request important, please also help to review the conflicting pull requests. Ideally, start with the one that should be merged first.

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -2,7 +2,7 @@
              ((gnu packages bash) #:select (bash-minimal))
              (gnu packages bison)
              ((gnu packages certs) #:select (nss-certs))
-             ((gnu packages cmake) #:select (cmake-minimal))
+             ((gnu packages cmake) #:select (cmake-3.30))
comments.body:
764af91cfe5dcde82a9ff9fe810a9ad1d579b3ac

Do we really want to switch from `cmake-minimal`, which brings in additional inputs such as `ncurses`, `python-sphinx` and `texinfo`? I've really appreciated the current setup since https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/commit/2c9eb4afe1f583aafa552b2711b149f17ef8320f.

FWIW, `cmake-minimal` was updated to 3.31.8 in https://codeberg.org/guix/guix/commit/3441c3e30d24c82c159d5d0049692dfd6bacd31c.

@@ -2,7 +2,7 @@
              ((gnu packages bash) #:select (bash-minimal))
              (gnu packages bison)
              ((gnu packages certs) #:select (nss-certs))
-             ((gnu packages cmake) #:select (cmake-minimal))
+             ((gnu packages cmake) #:select (cmake-3.30))
comments.body: I don't mind waiting for a later minimal update, can drop 764af91cfe5dcde82a9ff9fe810a9ad1d579b3ac.

comments.diff_hunk:

                  (make-bitcoin-cross-toolchain target)))
           ((string-contains target "darwin")
-           (list clang-toolchain-18
-                 lld-18
-                 (make-lld-wrapper lld-18 #:lld-as-ld? #t)

comments.body:
89a08d15668d8c7cbaf0e7f32b5fbfb9197b9dd5

We could switch to clang-19 in the CI as well. For example:
```diff
--- a/ci/test/00_setup_env_mac_cross.sh
+++ b/ci/test/00_setup_env_mac_cross.sh
@@ -9,7 +9,7 @@ export LC_ALL=C.UTF-8
 export SDK_URL=${SDK_URL:-https://bitcoincore.org/depends-sources/sdks}
 
 export CONTAINER_NAME=ci_macos_cross
-export CI_IMAGE_NAME_TAG="mirror.gcr.io/ubuntu:24.04"
+export CI_IMAGE_NAME_TAG="mirror.gcr.io/debian:trixie"
 export HOST=x86_64-apple-darwin
 export PACKAGES="clang lld llvm zip"
 export XCODE_VERSION=15.0
```

@@ -175,7 +175,6 @@ chain for " target " development."))
     (native-inputs (list cmake-minimal
                          ninja
                          python-scikit-build-core
-                         python-pydantic-core
comments.body:
b9c4e6f6c5cf84e574fc343ffa057b590a92426d

```diff
--- a/contrib/guix/manifest.scm
+++ b/contrib/guix/manifest.scm
@@ -18,7 +18,7 @@
              ((gnu packages python-build) #:select (python-poetry-core))
              ((gnu packages python-crypto) #:select (python-asn1crypto))
              ((gnu packages python-science) #:select (python-scikit-build-core))
-             ((gnu packages python-xyz) #:select (python-pydantic-2 python-pydantic-core))
+             ((gnu packages python-xyz) #:select (python-pydantic-2))
              ((gnu packages tls) #:select (openssl))
              ((gnu packages version-control) #:select (git-minimal))
              (guix build-system cmake)
```

comments.body: Pushed a commit up for this.

nit: Could clarify the rationale?
```suggestion
export CI_IMAGE_NAME_TAG="mirror.gcr.io/debian:trixie"  # Check that https://packages.debian.org/trixie/clang (version 19, similar to guix) can cross-compile
```
